name: Renraku Tsurugi
descriptionNotes: Balanced mid-range deck. Slight emphasis on Data Processing.

name: Microdeck Summit
descriptionNotes: Entry-level deck. Slightly higher Sleaze than Erika MCD-1.

name: Aztechnology Defender
descriptionNotes: Matrix damage taken is reduced by 1 (min 1), Dumpshock damage reduced by 2 (min 1). –2 Initiative penalty after rolling Initiative.

name: Aztechnology Shadow Warrior
descriptionNotes: +1 Sleaze actions limit and +1 Sleaze when Sleaze is highest configured attribute. Affordable stealth deck.

name: Erika MCD-1
descriptionNotes: Entry-level deck (Device Rating 1). Very low Firewall. Only supports a single program.

name: Evo Sublime
descriptionNotes: Implant-only deck. Allows limited meat-space actions in VR. –10 dice pool and –3 limit penalty to non-Matrix actions in VR.

name: Fairlight Destiny Blade
descriptionNotes: +1 Cybercombat limit, +1 Attack when Attack is highest configured attribute. Optimized for combat.

name: Fairlight Excalibur
descriptionNotes: Top-tier deck (Device Rating 6). Extremely expensive. Considered the best off-the-shelf deck.

name: Fortress (Security Deck)
descriptionNotes: High Firewall (8). Minimal Sleaze. Preloaded with Encryption, Shell, and Armor programs.

name: Fox (Hunter Deck)
descriptionNotes: Always hot-sim. Preloaded with Track, Shell, Hammer. Only runs Attack/Firewall programs.

name: Fuchi Cyber-Ex Series
descriptionNotes: Customizable deck. Can run Device Rating + 2 programs. Flexible but expensive.

name: Fuchi Cyber-N Series
descriptionNotes: Locked configuration. Only one program can run at a time. Chosen attribute array fixed permanently.

name: Great Wall (Security Deck)
descriptionNotes: Firewall 10. Minimal Sleaze. Preloaded with Encryption, Shell, Armor, Biofeedback Filter.

name: Guard (Security Deck)
descriptionNotes: Low-end security deck. High Firewall for its rating. Comes with Encryption program.

name: Hermes Chariot
descriptionNotes: Balanced Attack and Sleaze. Low Firewall. Good mid-tier option.

name: Kitbashed Sleeper
descriptionNotes: Contains Resonance fragment. Technomancers can use it, but deck absorbs Fade (10 Matrix condition boxes).

name: Microtrónica Azteca 200
descriptionNotes: Affordable Rating 2 deck. Balanced Attack and Sleaze. Reliable performance.

name: Novatech Navigator
descriptionNotes: Popular Rating 3 deck. Strong Attack and Sleaze. Well-rounded.

name: Shark (Hunter Deck)
descriptionNotes: Always hot-sim. Preloaded with Track, Shell, Hammer (x2), Decryption, Mugger, Fork.

name: Shiawase Cyber-5
descriptionNotes: High Attack and Sleaze. Average Firewall. Used by corporate deckers.

name: Shield (Security Deck)
descriptionNotes: Mid-tier security deck. Low Sleaze. Preloaded with Encryption and Shell.

name: Sony CIY-720
descriptionNotes: Strong Attack and Sleaze. Lower Firewall. Good mid-high tier option.

name: Tiger (Hunter Deck)
descriptionNotes: Always hot-sim. Preloaded with Track, Shell, Hammer (x2), Decryption.

name: Wolf (Hunter Deck)
descriptionNotes: Always hot-sim. Preloaded with Track, Shell, Hammer, Decryption.
